intro: Telipogon helleri, commonly known as the Heller's orchid, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its small, intricate flowers that often display a range of colors, including white, purple, and pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat loss and environmental changes, Telipogon helleri is considered threatened in its natural range.
